thread.title: US teams look for future Paralympians at scouting combines

author: senh
title: US teams look for future Paralympians at scouting combines
text:
BING NEWS: US teams look for future Paralympians at scouting combines BOSTON (AP) — Two years after losing his lower leg in a car crash, Matthew Freitas is faster and stronger than ever. The 14-year-old is nearing a 6-minute mile on the track, running with a prosthetic foot. He was the star goalie on his youth lacrosse ... 09/30/2015 - 7:58 pm | View Link US teams hope to find their next Paralympians at scouting combines nationwide But lately, he's been training for something else: This weekend, Freitas will join other athletes with physical and visual disabilities hoping to get noticed at a scouting event for the U.S. Paralympics. Coaches from national teams will run them through a ... Wopular is an online newspaper rack , giving you a summary view of the top headlines from the top news sites. Senh Duong (Founder) San Francisco Chronicle , Thursday - 10/01/2015 - 08:05 PM 
Braves president of baseball operations John Hart announced the move. Jessica Mendoza will become the first female analyst to call a postseason game when she works the American League wild-card matchup next week for ESPN. Mendoza had replaced Curt Schilling on the network’s top MLB announcing team for the rest of the regular season after the former pitcher was suspended last month in the wake of an anti-Muslim tweet. San Francisco Chronicle , Thursday - 10/01/2015 - 08:05 PM 
Late in the first quarter Sunday, Arizona wide receiver Larry Fitzgerald lined up the right slot against 49ers outside linebacker Aaron Lynch, who gave him a bump at the line of scrimmage before passing him off to … nobody. The play highlighted both the 49ers’ early-season pass-coverage issues and Bowman’s visible frustration as they have surrendered 676 passing yards en route to losing the past two games by a score of 90-25. [] three plays after Fitzgerald’s all-alone reception, Bowman again threw his hands to the heavens after Fitzgerald hauled in a 17-yard catch between inside linebacker Michael Wilhoite and cornerback Kenneth Acker. Fitzgerald had, again, lined up in the slot against an outside linebacker (Ahmad Brooks) and had roamed free after an initial bump. In the second quarter, Bowman raised his hands when tackle Tony Jerod-Eddie jumped offside and, along with the rest of the defense, he subsequently stopped for a few seconds as running back Chris Johnson embarked on an easy 15-yard scamper. The ultra-competitive linebacker’s frustration is understandable in the midst of a 40-point loss. After a 43-18 loss at Pittsburgh in Week 2 in which the 49ers surrendered six completions of at least 28 yards, Bowman was asked how he played: I made the plays that I could. On Thursday, defensive coordinator Eric Mangini was asked about Bowman’s frustration. Bowman, who has yet to speak with the media this week, is one of nine team captains and one of four defensive starters with more than 34 career starts. Wide receiver Anquan Boldin, another team captain, had animated conversations with quarterback Colin Kaepernick and head coach Jim Tomsula in the first half.
